Player History
Signed as a free agent by Toronto on 4/3/1985 to a minor league deal...
Had first career hit on 4/12/1985, off Dan Plesac (BOS)...
Hit first career homerun on 4/30/1985, off Mike Witt (SEA)...
Won World Series with Toronto in 1985...
Injured on 4/21/1986 with a Blister On Finger, out for 4 days...
Injured on 5/28/1986 with a Inflamed Elbow Ligament, out for one week...
Traded from Toronto to Atlanta on 4/3/1987 (Going to ATL: P Chuck Crim, P Ron Musselman, C Jerry Willard, CF Junior Felix, RF Joe Carter. Going to TOR: LF Don Carroll)...
Hit 3 homeruns against New York (M), driving in 5 runs on 5/15/1987...
Was selected to the 1987 Allstar game...
2/2/1988: Gets a new one-year contract worth $3,057,143 through salary arbitration...
8/17/1988: Signed a contract extension with Atlanta, $2,830,000 per year, for 4 years.
Won Player of the Week award on 9/11/1988, hitting .545 with 4 HR, 8 RBI...
Had 5 hits with 4 RBI against Pittsburgh on 6/24/1989...
Won Player of the Week award on 6/26/1989, hitting .536 with 4 HR, 13 RBI...
Hit 3 homeruns against Los Angeles, driving in 5 runs on 6/28/1989...
Was selected to the 1989 Allstar game...
Had 5 hits with 2 RBI against Philadelphia on 8/26/1989...
Won Player of the Week award on 8/28/1989, hitting .621 with 5 HR, 11 RBI...
Injured on 4/3/1991 with a Torn Calf Muscle, out for 6 weeks...
Won Batter of the Month award on 7/1/1991, hitting .314 with 12 HR, 30 RBI...
